title: Challenging Negative Core Beliefs
description: Identify and challenge deeper core beliefs that influence your thoughts and feelings

questions.prompt: List a recurring negative thought that you experience frequently:
questions.placeholder: Example: I'm going to fail. Nobody likes me. I can't handle this.

questions.prompt: If this thought were 100% true, what would it mean about you?
questions.placeholder: Example: It would mean I'm incompetent.

questions.prompt: And if that were true, what would that say about you as a person?
questions.placeholder: Example: It would mean I'm worthless or inadequate.

questions.prompt: Which category does your core belief fall into?
options: Lovability (e.g., I'm unlovable, I'll always be alone)
Worth/Value (e.g., I'm worthless, I don't deserve good things)
Competence (e.g., I'm incompetent, I can't do anything right)
Safety/Vulnerability (e.g., I'm always in danger, The world is unsafe)

questions.prompt: How strongly do you believe this core belief (1-10)?
When did you first start believing this about yourself? Can you identify early experiences that might have contributed to this belief?
questions.placeholder: Example: When I was criticized a lot as a child. When I failed at something important.

questions.prompt: What evidence contradicts this core belief?
questions.placeholder: Example: Times I've succeeded. People who care about me. Compliments I've received.

questions.prompt: How might this belief be overgeneralized or extreme?
questions.placeholder: Example: Using words like 'always,' 'never,' or applying one area of life to all areas.

questions.prompt: Write a more balanced, alternative core belief:
questions.placeholder: Example: I have strengths and weaknesses like everyone else. I am worthy of respect and care.

questions.prompt: After writing your balanced belief, how strongly do you believe your original negative core belief now (1-10)?
